attributes.action: provide more information of where and how the income from fuel duty is spent by central government
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: There are some 30,000,000 cars on UK roads purchasing fuel at an average rate of £100 per week, of which £80 of every £100 goes to central government. This amounts to £2.4 billion per week and does not include the duty income levied on Lorries whose spend is considerably higher. Where does central government spend this income?
